feat: Migrate to Cesium.js for high-quality terrain visualization

BREAKING CHANGE: 3D models must now be in glTF/GLB format \(not FBX\)

## What changed
- Replaced Three.js terrain \(Google Maps Static API 640x640\) with Cesium.js
- Added Cesium World Terrain with Bing Maps satellite imagery
- Quality now matches Google Earth / Mission Planner

## Why
- Google Maps Static API limited to 640x640 pixels \(blurry terrain\)
- Google Elevation API provided only 11x11 grid of elevation points
- Cesium.js provides streaming high-resolution terrain tiles

## New architecture
- src/cesium/CesiumViewer.js - Main viewer with World Terrain
- src/cesium/TrajectoryEntity.js - Flight path \(Yellow→Red gradient\)
- src/cesium/WaypointsEntity.js - Mission waypoints \(Purple→Cyan\)
- src/cesium/DroneEntity.js - 3D drone model
- src/cesium/CesiumCameraController.js - TOP/FOLLOW/FPV modes
- src/config/cesium.js - Cesium Ion token and settings

## Model format requirements
- IMPORTANT: Cesium requires glTF/GLB format \(not FBX\)
- Use convert_fbx_to_glb.py \(Blender script\) to convert models
- Textures must be embedded in GLB file
- Blender export: File → Export → glTF 2.0 \(.glb\) with Images=Embed

## Dependencies added
- cesium: ^1.125.0
- vite-plugin-cesium: ^1.0.26

## Other changes
- Added Migachev parser for custom waypoint format
- Improved drone orientation calculation with heading offset
- Three.js code preserved as fallback \(USE_CESIUM flag in main.js\)
